summary: The Golden Mussel Eradication and Control Act of 2025 aims to combat the spread of golden mussels. It mandates the establishment of a demonstration program led by a Task Force, involving research, monitoring, control, and eradication efforts in infested areas like the Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta.  The bill also introduces a grant program to fund innovative technologies and control methods. It authorizes appropriations of $15 million annually from 2026-2030 to combat the invasive species.
